Philosophy
FinInG is a package for computation in finite geometry. It provides users with the basic tools to work in various areas of finite geometry from the realms of projective spaces to the flat lands of generalised polygons. The algebraic power of GAP is employed, particularly in its facility with matrix and permutation groups.

Overview over this manual
Chapter describes the installation of this package. Chapter contains some extended examples, ot introduce the user a bit to the basic philosophy. Chapter contains a rigourous discription of basic structures. This chapter can be omitted at first reading, since the consequent chapters are also self contained. Chapters , and deal with projective spaces, projective semilinear groups, and polarities of projective spaces respectively. Chapter deals extensively with classical polar spaces. Chapter deails with affine spaces and their groups. Geometry morhpisms between various geometries that are treated in the first nine chapters, are introduced and discussed in Chapter . The final three chapters, , , and deals with algebraic varieties, which are constructed inside projective or affine spaces, generalised polygons, of which several models can be constructed in FinInG, and finally coset geometries and diagrams, respectively.
